content.description:
A Volcanic Eruption

Noctem illam tecti silvis immaniaimmanis, -e, adj. = ingens, -entis monstra 
perferimusperfero, -ferre = patior, -i, nec quae sonitum sonitus, -us, m. = sonus, -idet causa videmus. 
Nam neque erant astrorumastrum, -i, n. = sidus, -eris ignes nec luciduslucidus, -a, -um, adj. = clarus, -a, -um aethraaethra, -ae, f. = aether, -eris 
sidereasidereus, -a, -um, adj.: star-filled poluspolus, -i, m. = caelum, -i, obscuro sed nubila caelo.
content.question: In line 2, the clause nec quae sonitum det causa videmus specifies that the travelers

choices.label: tell themselves to look for the source of the sound
are making noises so that they may be seen
do not know what the source of the noise is
see that the monsters are shouting

content.answer: do not know what the source of the noise is

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
